page.title: 14Archaeology Around Garton
page.content: There is every reason to believe that the area has had continuous settlement since pre-historic times.Flint arrow- heads,scrapers and stone axe heads are sometimes found after ploughing.A valley known as Garton Slack has yielded considerable evidence of occupation from Neolithic to Anglian times. Some spectacular Iron Age chariot burials,belonging to the Arras culture were excavated in 1971,1984 and 1985. A Romano-British house and inclosure date from the 2nd & 3rd Centuries. A large Anglian cemetery discovered in the south-east of the parish consisted of two groups of graves,one pagan and the other christian. In l985 a team from the British Museum excavated a one acre site close to the village.An Anglian cemetery was found on top of Iron Age chariot burials.
